text: Toureen Peakaun is an ancient church located in County Tipperary, Ireland.http://megalithomania.com/show/site/1236/toureen_peakaun_holy_well.htmhttp://www.megalithomania.com/show/image/3849/toureen_peakaun.htm ==Location== Toureen Peakaun is located about northwest of Cahir. ==Description== In the 7th century, St Alban chose the Glen of Aherlow region as the location for a monastery. The site, known as Toureen Peakaun, features the ruins of a rectangular 12th century AD church. Of note are the cross-slab fragments in the wall and remains of crosses between the church and gate. Today, pilgrims continue to visit the church and the nearby holy well. ==References== Category:National Monuments in County Tipperary Category:Archaeological sites in County Tipperary
title: Toureen Peakaun
